_comment: Created by ianb on 17/01/2014 17:28:05 using v2.0
title: Infant mortality rate, how does the UK compare to similar countries over time?
analysis_commentary:
We can see that infant mortality rate for all countries has been decreasing with a similar trend since 1990. The country with the highest rate each year is the USA. The UK and Australia have similar rates below the USA, with France and Germany having the lowest.

One of the United Nations Millennium Development Goals was to reduce child mortality by two-thirds, between 1990 and 2015. Infant mortality rate is a measure used to monitor this. Here we can see the 2015 two-thirds reduction target for these countries. No country had reached their target in 2010, with the USA furthest away from their target.
data_source: World Health Organization, Child Health: Infant mortality by country
